bioghist.p: Charles Henry Burr, Jr., (1969-1925) attended Penn Charter School, Haverford College, and the University of Pennsylvania. He practiced international law in American cases involving interests in Germany, Holland, and England for the office of Thomas Leaming, Philadelphia. He won the Henry M. Phillips Prize of the American Philosophical Society for his essay "The Treaty-Making Power of the United States and the Methods of Its Enforcement..."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of chapters of Burr's historical study of the American Constitution, "Toward the American Constitution," which was never published. The collection also includes manuscripts of articles and a letter to the editor of a newspaper (the Metropolitan). These articles address a range of topics, including taxes, modern attitudes towards Christianity, Matthew Arnold, and Goethe.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
